title: Ministers raise prospect of new AI safety regulations as shooting questions mount
description: OTTAWA — Two federal ministers signalled today that Ottawa could act to improve online safety related to artificial intelligence as questions mount about OpenAI's decision not to warn police about Tumbler Ridge shooter Jesse Van Rootselaar.
content:

title: India poised to lead in AI governance if copyright is protected, says Charles Rivkin
description: As artificial intelligence reshapes filmmaking, music, and digital storytelling, global studios are looking to India not just as a market, but as a rule-setter. Hollywood’s top industry body says India’s policy stance on copyright, deepfakes, and AI governance could determine how much creative investment and innovation flows into the country in the years ahead.
content: As artificial intelligence reshapes filmmaking, music, and digital storytelling, global studios are looking to India not just as a market, but as a rule-setter. Hollywood’s top industry body says India’s policy stance on copyright, deepfakes, and AI ... [5123 chars]

title: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal says India has concluded nine free trade agreements covering 38 nations
description: India has signed nine free trade agreements with 38 nations, opening up access to almost two-thirds of global markets. These pacts will boost Indian goods, services, and talent mobility. Discussions are underway for new agreements, including with Canada. The nation's youth and skilled manpower are seen as key growth drivers. Artificial intelligence is expected to transform jobs, creating new opportunities.
content:

title: Musk asks US judge to block OpenAI’s use of WilmerHale probe at trial
description: Billionaire tech entrepreneur Elon Musk and his artificial intelligence company xAI have asked a federal judge to block jurors at an upcoming trial from considering prominent law firm WilmerHale’s investigation into Sam Altman's ouster and subsequent return as OpenAI's CEO.
content: WASHINGTON, Feb 25 (Reuters) - Billionaire tech entrepreneur Elon Musk and his artificial intelligence company xAI have asked a federal judge to block jurors at an upcoming trial from considering prominent law firm WilmerHale’s investigation into Sam... [1370 chars]

title: PM Modi becomes 1st Indian leader to address Israel’s Knesset, which other foreign parliaments has he addressed?
description: This is PM Modi's second trip to Israel after his 2017 visit. A series of agreements are expected to be signed, covering technology cooperation, security collaboration, artificial intelligence, agriculture, water management, and trade, reflecting the expanding scope of the bilateral partnership.
content:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is on a two-day high-profile visit to Israel, became the first Indian leader to address the Knesset, the Israeli parliament on Wednesday.
This is PM Modi’s second trip to Israel after his 2017 visit. A series of agre... [1736 chars]

title: Anthropic drops hallmark safety pledge in race with AI peers
description: Anthropic PBC, which for years billed itself as a safer alternative to artificial intelligence rivals, has loosened its commitment to maintaining its guardrails.
content:

title: Nvidia earnings slam into market with no patience for AI hiccups
description: Nvidia Corp.'s earnings report on Wednesday afternoon comes at a critical time for the US stock market with investors increasingly nervous about the outlook for artificial intelligence.
content:

title: In New Book "Lift,” Amy Summers Makes the Case for Human-Focused Mentorship in the AI Era
description: At its core, LIFT is about one simple belief: mentorship is a relationship - a shared commitment to potential, trust, and progress. Whether you're leading a team, growing into your next role, or building something of your own, this book is meant to help you become a leader who shows up, connects, and creates lasting impact for others and for yourself. NEW YORK, Feb. 25, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- As artificial intelligence and automation continue to reshape the modern workplace, leadership strategist Amy Summers, founder of the virtual mentorship platform INICIVOX, says human-focused mentorship is no longer optional but essential.
